title: Ticket #5490: add a -batch-name argument to condor_submit and condor_submit_dag
description:
The new condor_q can summarize a batch of jobs by grouping them by "batch name" where batch name is either the dag id, cluster id or a common command string. But it would be even more useful if users could set the batch name explicitly as an argument to condor_submit and condor_submit_dag or as a statement in the submit file or .dag file.

The command line option is more useful because it is more likely that submit and .dag files are re-used across batches of jobs than that they are recreated each time a new batch is desired.

a new argument -batch-name <name> should be added to both condor_submit and condor_submit_dag. This argument should result in the addition of a new attribute into the job ad created by these tools. The new attribute will be JobBatchName and condor_q will use this attribute in preference to it's generated batch names if it exists.
